SA43-d-10-02-90-SOO.Narrative: THERE HAD BEEN RADIO COMMUNICATION BETWEEN TRAINS 343 AND 227 ABOUT TRAIN 343 HANDLING THE SWITCH ATHIGHBRIDGE AFTER 227 HAD PASSED AND TRAIN 343'S CREW AGREED TO HANDLE THE SWITCH. TRAIN 227 DID NOTSLOW THE TRAIN PREPARING TO HANDLE THE FACING POINT SPRING SWITCH AT HIGH BRIDGE. THE NORMAL POSITION OF THIS SWITCH IS LINED FROM SINGLE TRACK TO THE EASTWARD TRACK AND WAS LINED FOR SUCH MOVEMENT.TRAIN 227'S CREW BELIEVED THAT THE CREW ON TRAIN 343 WAS HANDLING THE SWITCH AND WHEN THEY REALIZEDTHE SWITCH WAS NOT LINED FOR THEIR MOVEMENT, COULD NOT STOP SHORT OF COLLIDING WITH TRAIN 343. TRAIN#227'S CREW PULLED OUT OF SERVICE PENDING INVESTIGATION AND TESTED UNDER FRA POST ACCIDENT GUIDELINES. TEST RESULTS WERE AS FOLLOWS: ENGINEER - POSITIVE; CONDUCTOR - NEGATIVE; BRAKEMAN - NEGATIVE. INVESTIGATION WAS HELD ON OCTOBER 30, 1990 WITH THE FOLLOWING DISCIPLINE ASSESSED: ENGINEER OF TRAIN #227 WAS DISMISSED. BRAKEMAN OF TRAIN #227 WAS DISMISSED. CONDUCTOR OF TRAIN #227 HAS BEEN SUSPENDEDFROM SERVICE FOR A PERIOD OF 45 DAYS.NoneNoneNoneNone

1-d-10-18-90-NEKM.Narrative: THE CREW INVOLVED, CONSISTING OF TWO TRANSPORTATION SPECIALISTS, HAD LEFT THEIR TRAIN WEST OF THEIRUSUAL TIE UP POINT (HIAWATHA, KS) THE NIGHT BEFORE. AFTER GOING ON DUTY AT HIAWATHA AT 12:01 PM, THEY WENT BACK OUT WEST WITH A TWO UNIT CONSIST TO PICK UP THE TRAIN AND BRING IT EAST TO HIAWATHA. THECREW STRUCK THE TRAIN ON A DESCENDING GRADE OF SLIGHTLY MORE THAN 1% IN A LEFT HAND CURVE OF 3 DEGREES, 06 MINUTES. THE CREW STATED IN A POST INCIDENT INTERVIEW THAT THEY FORGOT WHERE THE TRAIN WAS AND DIDN'T SEE IT UNTILL IT WAS TOO LATE. BOTH CREW MEMBERS WERE TAKEN TO THE OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH SERVICES, INC CLINIC IN ST JOSEPH, MO FOR URINE SPECIMENS THAT AFTERNOON. BOTH CREW MEMBERS HAVE BEEN SUSPENDED FROM SERVICE AWAITING THE RESULTS OF THOSE TESTS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

102890A-d-10-28-90-ATK.Narrative: THE SWITCH CREW WAS MAKING A REVERSE MOVE ONTO TRACK 15 INTENDING TO COUPLE CONTROL CAR 1648 ONTO ENGINE 1054 WHICH WAS ON TRACK 15. THE CONDUCTOR OF THE CREW HAD BOARDED ENGINE 1054 AND RELEASED THEINDEPENDENT BRAKE ASSUMING THAT THE HITCH HAD BEEN MADE. THE ENGINEER ON THE LEADING END OF THE MOVEMENT OPERATING FROM THE 1066 WAS TOLD TO PULL FORWARD ONTO THE LEAD IN REALIZING THE HITCH WAS NOT SUCCESSFUL LEAVINGTHE 1054 STILL ON TRACK 15. THE ASSISTANT CONDUCTOR WHO HAD BOARDED THE REVERSE MOVE ONTO TRACK 13 WAS POSITIONED ON THE BLIND SIDE AND DIDNOT NOTICE THAT THE 1054 HAD ROLLED INTO A FOULING POSITION BETWEEN TRACKS 15 AND 13. AT THAT POINT IMPACT WAS INEVITABLE AND COLLISION OCCURRED. THE CIRCUMSTANCES SURROUNDING THE INCIDENT PROVIDED SUFFICIENT FACTS FOR REASONABLE CAUSE TESTINGAND ALL THREE CREW MEMBERS WERE TAKEN FOR D & A TESTING. THE RESULTS PROVIDED BY THE TEST WERE NEGATIVE FOR ALL CREW MEMBERS INVOLVED. SUBSEQUENT INVEASTIGATION SHOWED THE CAUSE TO BE FAILURE ON THE PART OF THE GROUND CREW (CONDUCTOR, ASSISTANT CONDUCTOR) TO INSURE THAT A PROPER HITCH HAD BEEN MADE.NoneNoneNoneNone
